archipelago_basebox.name: Placeholder archipelago item (vague info about multiworld item type here?)
archipelago_basebox.description: Placeholder item for consumable archipelago checks, namely shop items (put information about the corresponding multiworld item here?)

getgearrough: Toss out your weapons and I won't rough you up.
You hear a quiet but heated discussion inside.  Eventually a voice says "All right," and some pistols fall out the window.
Just kidding, I'm still going to rough you up a little.
getgear: Toss out your weapons and I won't arrest you.
You hear a quiet but heated discussion inside.  Eventually a voice says "All right," and some pistols fall out the window.
Just kidding, I'm still going to arrest you.

win: Justice has been served to the old House gang.
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

e: He had a jaw harp in his pocket!
Maybe they killed him for playing the jaw harp too much.

popup: The remains of a group of outlaws, tragically killed by a giant spider.
There's a tattooed tooth in one of the skulls.
take: It comes out real easy like.  The spider venom must've loosened things up.
Also, though the rest of the bones are picked clean, the gang's stripey hats lie nearby.  Apparently even the spider was disgusted by them.  You take one.
Cavern Canyon - Stripey Hat Gang Killed
Cavern Canyon Bar - Behind the Bar

win: You put an end to the Stripey Hat Gang's reign of bad taste.
You take the leader's tattooed tooth, as a means of identifying him.
You also take one of those horrible hats, as a souvenir.
Cavern Canyon - Stripey Hat Gang Killed
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

open: You dig through the crate.  It's mostly full of packing straw, but you find a pretty fancy knife at the bottom!
Cavern Canyon Spider Cave - Weapens Box
You hear a sudden chittering coming from that big hole behind you.
Cavern Canyon Spider Cave - Medisun Box
You hear a sudden chittering coming from that big hole behind you.
You open the crate to find a single bottle of booze.  It's not the fanciest in the world, but for these parts, it's pretty fancy.
Cavern Canyon Spider Cave - Booze Box
You hear a sudden chittering coming from that big hole behind you.

crack: The safe contains an extremely broad-brimmed hat.

win: Thanks to your unrivaled peacemaking abilities, that ghost is definitely at peace now.
Abandoned Pickle Factory Cukes Room - Ghost Put To Rest
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
fix: It's...  It's finally done.  Thank you.
The ghost smiles as he fades away.  A few bones hit the ground below it.
Abandoned Pickle Factory Cukes Room - Ghost Put To Rest

win: You've put that unfortunate bandit to rest.  Maybe now he'll have less of a salty attitude.
Abandoned Pickle Factory Salt Room - Ghost Put To Rest
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
fix: It's...  It's finally done.  Thank you.
The ghost smiles as he fades away.  A few bones hit the ground below it.
Abandoned Pickle Factory Salt Room - Ghost Put To Rest

win: You set that ghostly fellow to rights, all right.
Abandoned Pickle Factory Vinegar Room - Ghost Put To Rest
Weird.  He didn't even have legs.
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
fix: It's...  It's finally done.  Thank you.
The ghost smiles as he fades away.  A few bones hit the ground below it.
Abandoned Pickle Factory Vinegar Room - Ghost Put To Rest

success: You pull the lever and there is a deafening roar as the old machinery springs into life.
After a while, a load of pickles is deposited in the receptacle to the left of the switch.
Huh.  All that work for three pickles?  No wonder this place went out of business.
The ghost from the cucumber room drifts through the door, gives you a grateful look, then clatters to the floor as it is replaced with a pile of bones.
Abandoned Pickle Factory Cukes Room - Ghost Put To Rest
The ghost from the salt room drifts through the door, gives you a grateful look, then collapses into a pile of remains.
Abandoned Pickle Factory Salt Room - Ghost Put To Rest
The ghost from the vinegar room drifts through the door, gives you a grateful look, then vanishes in a puff of bones.
Abandoned Pickle Factory Vinegar Room - Ghost Put To Rest

get: Abandoned Pickle Factory Vinegar Room - Coal Cart
You plop a big ol' glob of yeast into your pack.
Ol' Schmaltz Brewery - Deceased Yeast Beast
Three cans of beer on the wall, three cans of beer! Take them all down and put them in your bag, instead of singing the rest of this song about beer!

start: There are quite a few good books on here, actually!

popup: Going through Chuck's drawers seems like maybe not a good idea.
There is a key on top of the dresser, though.

take: You sling the sack of mail over your shoulder. Neither rain nor sleet nor super-creepy B&B proprietors.

picklock: The locker contains the key to itself and a few miscellaneous sundries.

prob5: We keep a municipal soup kitchen open to help those who're down on their luck -- which is pretty much everybody 'round here. But we've run out of soup, and need someone to go fetch some more from Soupstock Lode.
He gives you a stack of bread bowls to carry the soup in.
Breadwood Mayor's Office - Soup Quest Accepted

yes: He marks the location of the cemetery on your map.

seven: Boots, great. Boots full of bandit spit. I hope they have to invent a whole new kind of trenchfoot just for you. I hope they name it after you.
You're just jealous of my sweet new boots.

take: If this doesn't call for a 'yoink!' sound effect, I don't know what does.

grab: The skull was resting on top of a commemorative spoon! Your treasure-hunting senses are finely honed, though not very discriminating.

inv: Amid the other refuse, you find something strange.

finish: You've recovered all of the relics! Oh, praise be! Thank you!
I'm glad to have helped, Sister.
I must reward you for your efforts, though. We don't have much, but you might find this handy? One of our old priests left it behind.
Old Mission - Holy Relic Quest Completed

win: Well done!  Now Santa Cortada's in pieces so small they can't do any harm.
Old Mission Catacombs - Santa Cortada Defeated (Item 1)
Old Mission Catacombs - Santa Cortada Defeated (Item 2)
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
You put an end to Saint Pope's heresy once and for all.
Old Mission Catacombs - Saint Pope Defeated (Item 1)
Old Mission Catacombs - Saint Pope Defeated (Item 2)
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
The bigger they are, the harder they excommunicate.
Old Mission Catacombs - Saint Beefus Defeated (Item 1)
Old Mission Catacombs - Saint Beefus Defeated (Item 2)
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

pick: At the center of the pile, you unearth (unskull?) a shiny black stone.  It's making more noise than stones usually do.
Old Mission Catacombs - Cemented Skull Pile

skeleton3: This is an owl skeleton.  If you want to know how many fireballs it takes to get to the center of an enemy skeleton, just ask an owl.
bloof,Increase your Spell Damage\nfor the rest of the day
Take a picture of it [Requires the owl camera]

dig: You poke around their campsite for a bit, but don't find anything of value apart from the leader's knife and a ticket to the circus. Well, the harmonica maybe, but that clown had his lips all over it. *shudder*

You also find a note (in one of the lead clown's pockets... eww). It seems to be orders to check out an abandoned tannery not far from Dirtwater. It's probably a bad idea to let these guys wander around near town, so maybe you should investigate.
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

start: Howdy there, @miss@! Interest ya in a toy balloon?
How do you make them float like that?
buyit: All righty then! Here you go!

cont11: You bow to the cheering crowd, carefully keeping your eyes on Barnaby Bob. He bows as well, removing his hat with an elaborate flourish, and then he takes a slip of paper out of it.
And as a token of appreciation, I'd like to give our star volunteer a gift: a year's supply of dynamite! Use it in good health!
As he hands you the coupon, the clown leans in close to your ear and whispers:
This was the only warning you'll get, @boy@.
Barnaby Bob waves and blows kisses to the crowd as you climb down from the stage, and then he disappears through the backstage curtain. The audience gradually disperses.

open: The dial looks pretty complex and has weird squiggles instead of numbers. Fortunately, the impact knocked it wide open, so that doesn't matter.
It contains a few scorched and blackened fragments of what you think might be eggshell, and a pretty nice pair of boots that seem undamaged.

popup: "Cotton candy." says the clown behind this food stand. "Come try this... cotton candy."
"Cotton candy!" calls the clown behind this food stand, and then makes a fweeee-oooot! noise with a slide-whistle. "Come try this just-invented confectionary delight!"

start: The clown blows his slide-whistle again as you approach.
Step right up, @miss@. Step up and try one of the world's newest candy ...things.
Fwoooo-eeeet! Step right up, @miss@! Step up and try one of the world's newest candy sensations!
what: Cotton candy. The finest spun sugar, created through a revolutionary new process. It's so light and sweet and fluffy, it's... well, it's really great.

Cotton candy! The finest -- in several senses of the word -- spun sugar, created through a revolutionary new process! It's so light and sweet and fluffy, it's like eating butterfly dreams and kitten wishes! Fwoooooo-eeeeeet!
cotton: So it isn't actually made of cotton?
What? No. Cotton is indigestible, no matter how much chocolate you cover it with.
Found that out the hard way, did you?
...I don't want to talk about it.
invented: No, some dentists down south were the first ones. But after hearing about it, I managed to figure out how it works, pretty much.

Not as such -- couple dentists down south were the first ones. Dentists! Go figure! Fweeeeeeee-oooooot! But after hearing about it, I managed to figure out how it works. Made a few improvements with my design, too!
please: Nope. These secrets in this box are for nobody's eyes but my own. I can sell you some cotton candy, though.
Sorry, @miss@! These secrets in this box are for nobody's eyes but my own! Fweeee-oooot! I'll be happy to sell you some cotton candy, though!
howmuch: Just 300 Meat! ...or my slide-whistle, if you happen to find it. I really miss my slide-whistle.
I'll take one. [Requires 300 Meat or slide-whistle]
You know, I think I saw a slide-whistle...
buy: I found this slide-whistle. Is it yours?
stealwhistle: The clown puts his slide whistle down on the counter and ducks underneath; you quickly snatch the whistle and slip it into your pocket.
front: You quickly shut the box and dart back to the front of the counter just before the clown returns. He gives you a momentary suspicious look, but is quickly distracted by the joy of getting his slide-whistle back.
Fwoooooo-eeeeeeeet! You were right! Thank you so much!

The clown carefully puts his slide whistle in his shirt pocket, ducks underneath the counter, and comes back up with a paper cone, which he holds in the mouth of the metal box. He pulls down a lever and the box emits a thin squealing sound as something resembling glittering white spun sugar collects around the paper cone in a fluffy cloud.
paymeat: The clown carefully puts his slide whistle in his shirt pocket, ducks underneath the counter, and comes back up with a paper cone, which he holds in the mouth of the metal box. He pulls down a lever and the machine makes a thin squealing sound as glittering white spun sugar collects around the paper cone in a fluffy cloud.

The clown ducks under the counter and comes back up with a paper cone, which he holds in the mouth of the metal box. He pulls down a lever and the machine makes a thin squealing sound as glittering white spun sugar collects around the paper cone in a fluffy cloud.

The clown puts his slide whistle down on the counter, ducks underneath, and comes back up with a paper cone, which he holds in the mouth of the metal box. He pulls down a lever and the machine makes a thin squealing sound as glittering white spun sugar collects around the paper cone in a fluffy cloud.
paywhistle: I found this slide-whistle. Is it yours?
Oh my gosh, it is! Thank you so much!

The clown carefully puts his slide whistle in his shirt pocket, ducks underneath the counter, and comes back up with a paper cone, which he holds in the mouth of the metal box. He pulls down a lever and the machine makes a thin squealing sound as glittering white spun sugar collects around the paper cone in a fluffy cloud.
Here you go, @miss@! It's on the house!

level3: You take careful aim and pop off rounds (and balloons) for as long as you can hold the gun together.
Hey, not bad! Not bad at all! Not enough balloons for our grand prize, but it's worth a li'l something!
He gives you a little toy stuffed cat.
Limit one kitten per customer, though.
level4: I'm not sure exactly how a jaguar shoots, but presumably it's pretty good. You clear nearly the entire wall of balloons, and the clown looks genuinely impressed.
Well I'll be! Looks like you win! Congratulations on the finest shooting I've seen in quite a time!
The show will be starting soon, so don't miss it!
showover: He hands you a large and reasonably well-made toy stuffed cat.

level3: You pick up the mallet, take a deep breath, and smash that lever with a mighty swing. The little bell-striker makes it nearly -- but not quite! -- to the bell.
Well now! That was very close. Not a grand prize winner, but it's the best I've seen today and that's got to be worth something!
He hands you a small teddy bear.
Limit one per customer on the teddy bears, though.
level4: You pick up the mallet, toss it end-over-end and catch it a couple of times to test its weight, and casually slam it into the lever.
Well I'll be! That's some gen-u-ine muscle you've got on you, @fella@! Looks like you're a winner!
The show will be starting soon, so don't miss it!
showover: He hands you a large and reasonably well-made teddy bear.

level3: The clown starts picking cards out of the deck and holding them up with the backs to you. You manage to guess about two-thirds of them.
Say, that's not bad! Not enough to win the grand prize, but you deserve some recognition for that, my friend.
He gives you a little toy stuffed owl.
Limit one per customer on the owls, though.
level4: The clown starts picking cards out of the deck and holding them up with the backs to you. You rattle off their names as fast as he can pick them up. He seems genuinely impressed.
That, @sir@, is so remarkable as to be practically frightening. Looks like we have a winner!
The show will be starting soon, so don't miss it!
showover: He hands you a large and reasonably well-made plush owl.

post: Hello again, @maam@! Thanks for finding my lucky bottle cap!
okay: The kid runs off with his new balloon.

handstamp: The ticket booth clown recognizes you and waves you toward the circus entrance.
The ticket booth clown eyes you warily and waves you through the circus entrance.
The ticket booth clown kind of gives you the stink-eye, but he waves you through the circus entrance anyway.
The ticket booth clown just sort of glares at you.
I'd like to buy another ticket.
buycheckintro: I'd like to buy another ticket.
The clown cocks an eyebrow and looks back and forth between you and @pardnername@.
Only one ticket per person, and I already told you pardners get in free.
Okay, but like, you must have something else I can buy?  I really need to buy something here.
He glances around his stand before bending over, grabbing something from beneath the booth.
Alright look, you could buy this thing?  No idea where it came from or who it belongs to.  You could have it for... let's say 1,000 Meat?
buycheck: You drop the Meat on the booth and he pushes the thing over to you.
Pleasure doing business with you, I guess.

buyfihun: Let me just stamp your hand for re-entry... there you go. Enjoy the show!
buyit: You unload 5,000 Meat onto the counter. The clown looks surprised.
You unload 7,500 Meat onto the counter. The clown looks surprised.
You unload 10,000 Meat onto the counter. The clown looks surprised.
Well, uh... okay! I guess you've bought yourself a ticket! Let me just stamp your hand for re-entry... there we go. Enjoy the show!
outfox5: I don't know, this still seems shady to me. I'm pretty sure you're hiding something. Maybe something you wouldn't want the marshals to find out about...
Hey, wow, jeez @mister@! Fine, you win -- look, it's on the house, okay? Just gimme your hand so I can stamp you for re-entry. ...There. Good grief.
Yeah, don't mention it. Literally, do not mention it.
hornswoggle4: That's still outside the normal price range.
Hey, come on, we had to travel a long way to get here, we've got expenses and... stuff.
I would hate to discover that you were hiding anything from me.
Of course not! Of course not. Look, I tell you what, you're a VIP, you get the VIP ticket -- on the house. Lemme just stamp your hand for re-entry... Okay! Enjoy the show!

searchit:
Most of the contents are trashed from being stomped on. You do find a dented can of "potted meat", though.

You also notice that the knapsack has a knife sheath strapped to the side, but you don't see the knife anywhere.

search: You poke around in the tattered shreds of his clothes and find an old key.

cowsbane: It's an herb used for tanning leather. You can't grow it in large batches any more because cows show up and wreck the place, so there's other stuff we generally use for pig leather and so on. It's not as good though.
Yeah, if you're growing more than about a flowerpot's worth, they get wind of it somehow. They hate the stuff. Can't figure why. Here, I've got a few extra seeds you can have. Be careful with them.
Danny's Tannery (St. Rage Shed) - Grady's Cowsbane Seeds
How long have you been in here?
Well, I took care of the clowns and the cows...

win2: Whew, what a mess that fight was. And what a mess the floor is afterward. At least now you're free to poke around the scenery.
You take that nasty clown's knife, and oh look! They also had a key!
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

openit: Besides the miscellaneous scraps and junk that naturally accumulate in toolboxes, you find a handful of nails and a pair of sizeable, sharp, and serious-looking scissors.

getpuz: Heh.  He loves stuff like this.

leaving: heirloom,your grandmother's favorite can of beans
heirloom,your grandmother's briefcase full of snakes
Listen, I... want you to have this.  It's $heirloom$.

mom3: Yep!  It's that book you wanted for Crimbo.  I know it's early, but...
The one about picking locks?  Oh boy!
book: The one about picking locks?  Oh boy!

coolbook: Oh hey, this one might come in handy.

dig: It's mostly just boring broken bones, but you do find a skull with a weird tag on it...

dig3: You finally manage to reach all the way to the bottom of the bag, and retrieve a sodden lump from the bottom.
You unglob the wad and dry it off, then wash your arm in a nearby ditch.

win: You put a stop to that skeleton's magical dancing.
You help yourself to his sweet knife.
The Daveyard Mausoleum - The Skeleton of Dave B. Defeated
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

digup: You dig up the grave, just to check the veracity of the epitaph.
Sure enough -- boots but no pants!

digthru: You dig through the rags and find a few things that look like they're worth keeping.

piano2: Hmm... Maybe my info's too old. I found a note from some travelers that passed through here about eight years ago.
Ohhh. Yeah, that was the previous bartender. He had a, uh, a little trick he used to offer to show people. It's what got him fired, eventually. That senator's wife wasn't amused.
He rummages around under the bar for a minute, then blows the dust off a tiny piano, about nine inches tall.
Here, you can keep the piano, so long as you don't ask me about the trick.

give2: Ah, a nice big one. That'll last a while. Good going.
Okay, so, if you're still looking for stuff to do, I need someone to go check my mail. I ordered a new sauté knife, but I haven't got time to go fetch it myself. Here's the key to my post office box.
give4: Hey, thanks a million, buddy!  Now my slop will be world-famous!
Here, let me give you a little something for all your trouble. It fell in the slop, but it's still good.

popup: This little girl is selling flowers.
A big cabinet of locked post-office boxes.

start: You find P. O. box 441, the one that belongs to the chef at the Jewel.
You find P. O. box 114, for which you found the key at Fort Treason.
open441: You open the box and a torrent of junk mail falls out to reveal a knife, just sitting loose in the box.
open114: You open the box.  It's empty except for a single sheet of card stock with columns of numbers on it in tiny print.

codes2: After a couple of minutes, she comes back with a sheet of note paper.
Okay, so each map has a code number on it, y'see? Based on region an' direction a' travel...
She explains how to work out the code you need, and gives you a cheat sheet for reference.

seven: You found something. You found a tacky, filth-covered, porcelain cow figurine. A useless, disgusting thing that will make a great heirloom for your children, assuming you're still able to have any, and you hate them.

popup: You sense a deposit of bean iron!

take: You grab the device.  The Perfessor will want to see this.
El Vibrato Chamber (Lost Dutch Oven Mine) - Leftmost Box

open: There's a strange cloth loop inside. At least it feels more or less like cloth.
El Vibrato Chamber (Lost Dutch Oven Mine) - Locked Box

win: You put an end to that pie-shooting goblin's reign of terror.  All the world's pies thank you.
Fort Cowardice Back Office - General Gob's Hat
Fort Cowardice Back Office - General Gob's Pistol
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
hat: Wait. Leaving a gun and hat here. They will not safe being.
Yes. Good. You protecting them for me.
Fort Cowardice Back Office - General Gob's Hat
Fort Cowardice Back Office - General Gob's Pistol
hatgun: You should leaving a hat and gun. Having a fresh start.
Yes, correct being. I will fighting each pie as if it is first pie being.
Fort Cowardice Back Office - General Gob's Hat
Fort Cowardice Back Office - General Gob's Pistol
gun: Leaving the gun and hat. Fighting a pie with honor, with fists and face.
Yes, you are correct. Truly a pie must be with my own strength fighting.
Fort Cowardice Back Office - General Gob's Hat
Fort Cowardice Back Office - General Gob's Pistol

papers: The papers are mostly just boring medical records.  Dental daguerrotypes, lamentations that antibiotics haven't been discovered yet, that kind of thing.
Hey wait, what's this?  This looks like it might be important.
Fort Cowardice Math Tent - Desk Papers

open: You open the safe and put the controlled substances under your own control.

get: You bolster your supply of medical goods at the expense of the shelf's.

yep: There's a single pie inside, shot to pieces.
Fort Cowardice Back Office - Pie Safe

open: One of those things is enough.
This spice cabinet has provided all the value it's going to provide.
It's just a bunch of unlabeled green shakers.  Better leave them alone -- they might be poison instead of spices, for all you know.
givepeter: Little green unlabelled jars. Hopefully, this is the stuff the chef was looking for.
Fort Cowardice Mess Hall - Spice Rack

start: You hear the sounds of several goblins snoring inside this tent.
bomb: You wait until Gary is looking the other way, sidling closer to the entrance as you whistle nonchalantly.
You press the cap on the fungus bomb, toss it into the tent, and hold the flaps closed until the popping and sizzling noises stop.  You should be safe in there now.

open: Fort Cowardice First Tent - Back-Left Footlocker
Fort Cowardice First Tent - Front-Right Footlocker

picklock: Fort Cowardice First Tent - Back-Right Footlocker

win: You won the fight!  Go you!
Fort Cowardice Goblin Caves - First Victory
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
You brush yourself off, collect your loot, and climb back out of the pit.
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

picklock: You pick the lock, revealing the footlocker to be full of... human bones!

node3: The last thing is a little diary, which you decide to leave in there in case the owner comes back looking for it.

popup: And the flusher is broken.  Yuck.
The flush handle is missing, though.
get: You grab the contents of the toilet, you sicko.
Hey... This gave you an idea.  If the undead produce waste, maybe it can make them unundead.

e: Oh good, a disgusting old hat.

good: You manage to snag the pencil with the corner of your temporary visitor permit and yank it out of the cactus. Nice!
Oh, wait... this is a number 4 pencil.

permit9: Sure do! That thing pops the tops off beer bottles like you wouldn't believe!
So long as it removes staples, I'll be happy.
I imagine it does, but I'm afraid I'm not authorized for unstapling. You'll have to take it back over to Records. Here y'are.
ordere: There ya go! Don't drink it all in one place!

welcome: Department of Records. How can I help you, @mr@ @idlastname@?
I'm here on behalf of the mayor of Breadwood. He needs a permit...
I'm supposed to pick up a file on the town of Breadwood.
Okay, I'm back with those papers.
The Department of Libations needs to borrow your staple remover...
Umm... I can't think of anything.
permit5: All right, let me just put those in an official Inter-Department Document Transfer Folder for you... there you are.
beeropen: The Department of Libations needs to borrow your staple remover again.
All right. I don't get much use out of it since we took Adjunct Records' stapler away anyway.

welcome: @mr@ ...@idlastname@, was it? What can I do for you?
I'm here on behalf of the mayor of Breadwood. He needs a permit...
I'm supposed to pick up a file on the town of Breadwood.
The Department of Records sent me over here to pick up a file.
Okay, I got you a stapler.
Administration wants you to unstaple these papers.
permit4: Great! Ahh, there's nothing better than that new stapler smell.
Can I have that logging report now?
You bet! Kerchunk! Here you go, freshly-stapled and wind-resistant!

permit3i: I'm sorry @maam@, that's the wrong answer. I'm afraid I can't approve this requisition. I can, however, provide you with this.

hitempexp2: Unfortunately I can't accept an expired pass.
Can I get a new one?
newtemp: My visitor pass expired. Can I have another one?
Sorry @sir@, only one pass per visitor. I'd be glad to help you apply for a full visitor ID, though.
But I still don't have a pencil.
temppermit6b: Correct. All right, everything seems to be in order. Here's your temporary visitor pass.
realpermit7a: Correct. All right, everything seems to be in order. Allow me to officially welcome you to the town of Ghostwood. Here's your visitor ID.
Thank you. Say, was it always called Ghostwood, or...
permit11k: Good. Now, just take this back to the mayor of Breadwood, and have him sign on this line here, and initial over here.
Ghostwood Town Hall - The Final Form
I don't know how to do that.
permit15: Let me look... ah yes, here it is. And there you are.
Ghostwood Town Hall - Permit Finally Processed
I don't have to sign anything to collect it?

4pencil: You stick the #4 pencil into the sharpener and grind off about a quarter of it.

e: You very, very slowly gather up the dynamite in the crate.

goin2: You enter what turns out to be a delicatessen, and help yourself to what turn out to be sandwiches. Probably.

menu: Look in a more random drawer
Look in an even randomer drawer
rand1: There's nothing in the drawer, but you find an old lollipop stuck to the bottom of the drawer above it.
Gustavson Gulch Storage Hut - Random Item
This drawer has a sandwich in it.  It must've been filed under sandwich.
Gustavson Gulch Storage Hut - More Random Item
This one contains a rolled-up pair of terrible pants.
Gustavson Gulch Storage Hut - Even Randomer Item
You don't find anything else interesting.
Wait, what's this?  Nope, nothing, false alarm.
Gustavson Gulch Storage Hut - Randomest Item (Eureka)
I mean it.  There's nothing left in here.
getkey: Gustavson Gulch Storage Hut - Secret Item

start: You hear some dramatic-sounding nonsense through the door.
win: You close the curtains on the goblin's final performance.
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
speakstart: You press your ear to the door and hear somebody delivering what sound like lines from Hamlet, except in Goblintongue.
From this vantage point, you also notice a sign next to the door reading "Backstage Entrance Here It Being!" with an arrow pointing to the back of the building.
Go in and break a leg [Fight]
back2: You watch for a while. The bits where the actor has to do a swordfight with themselves are pretty entertaining.
alreadylistened: Through the door you hear the actor mumbling to themselves and rehearsing some lines over and over.
They're not the only one that's gonna butcher Hamlet [Fight]

goin2: You enter what turns out to be a café, and reconstruct a few cups of chicory from the leavings in various dirty cups and sinks.
You stop to wonder why a café wouldn't be open at this time of day.  You see a schedule posted on the wall and sure enough, it says somebody named Gene is supposed to be working this shift.
He always was a shiftless layabout, that Gene.

win: You win! That'd show them, if they weren't dead now!
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
bomb: You open the door a crack and toss the bomb in.  A few minutes later, after the fumes settle, you enter the shack and survey the carnage.
It's a very profitable carnage! Three whole goblins worth of carnage!

look: Hey! Wow! It contains an entire year's supply of dynamite! Nice!
Gustavson Gulch Treasure Cave - Middle Chest

picklock: Gustavson Gulch Treasure Cave - Bottom Chest (Item 1)
Gustavson Gulch Treasure Cave - Bottom Chest (Item 2)

seven: Kind a' him to bury me, though. Guess he weren't all bad.
Do you... do you want to see Felicity again? I could take you to her ghost.
...Nah. I reckon I'll just go back to sleep. Ain't right, a dead fella walkin' 'round. Just tell her sorry for me, alright? Here, you can give 'er my pocketwatch, she'll recognize it.

popup: You sense a deposit of bean iron!

get: Snakepit Mine - The Pick in the Stone

popup: You sense a deposit of bean iron!

dig: Weird.  There was a compass buried there.

open1: The locker contains one of those mining helmets with a lamp on it and a bottle of laudanum.

e: Lost Dutch Oven Mine (Pit) - Emerald Rock

open: Heh.  Could've used this five minutes ago.

e: You tighten the loose screws, and some ore gets jarred loose from upsluice.

seven: You pull the world's most disgusting pair of pants out of the spittoon, and jump back as the hole at the spittoon's bottom, now unplugged, begins to leak steaming filth.
Congratulations. You are now the proud owner of the worst object I've ever been paid to think about, narrowly defeating a leather bondage harness made from the skin of a clown.

popup: You sense a deposit of bean iron!

dig: It's mostly filled with trash, but you do find a spooky white mask. Weird.

picklock: Nice work!  The toolbox is, unsurprisingly, full of tools.

e: Nothing interesting.  Oh, wait, there's actually a postcard in here that you could use.
Postal Way Station - Middle Newspaper Stack

letter: Oh hey, there's an undelivered letter underneath the stack.
Postal Way Station - Top-Right Newspaper Stack
You look at the address and jot it down on your map.
roybean,Roy Bean's House of Justice and Jellybeans

intro3: Aha! As I suspected, this is one of their transponders. It detects other El Vibrato technology and homes in, you see. That'll be why it led you here, I've got a thing I've been trying to repair.
He tinkers around with the transponder for a bit and then plugs a strange stone marble into a socket on it.
There you go! Good as new! Just swipe up or down to turn it on or off.
The Perfessor's House - Show the Stone Arrow

popup: The remains of your triumph over that crazy rock pile / guy.
Grab a rock for Dr. Morton
e: You grab a rock, which you hope is sufficiently interesting.
Railroad Camp (East) - Rock Monster's Remains (Dr. Morton's Quest)

getblood: A chill runs down your spine as you touch the goblet.
smash: You don't know what this is, but you know it's abominable.  You grab the goblet and smash it against the altar.
Everywhere the blood lands, cracks appear.  The altar groans as it crumbles into ruin.  In the rubble, something catches your eye, previously hidden beneath the unholy shrine.

take: You upend the pot into your pack.

search: You find a charred locket among the blackened bones.

picklock: You pick the lock and open the box.

win: The outhouse is now safe as houses.  Outhouses.
By the soft light of the fading embers, you see a glint of light from below.  You hold your nose with one hand as you fish out your prize with the other.
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

open: You open the safe.  Somebody in the Stearns family was quite the investor, it appears!

inv: Your deft fingers find a hidden catch, and the back panel of the shelf slides away to reveal a secret compartment.

buy: Lazy-A Dude Ranch - Purchased Herbal Remedy
alreadybought: You don't feel the need to buy anything else.

yesbane: I sure do, man! Baled it up for ya and everything!
yeshat: Nice, man! Barter is like, commerce, man, except natural, can you dig it?
Lazy-A Dude Ranch - Dreads Dude Hat Trade

get: You manage to gather up three jars worth.

popup: You sense a deposit of bean iron!

barbedwire: Lookin' ta keep some cows off yer property, eh? Good thinkin'.
He takes the coil of barbed wire, and gives it back a short time later, shiny and gleaming.
The Silver Plater - Plated Barbed Wire
turnip: He takes the turnip, and gives it back a short time later, shiny and gleaming.
Hadda hollow it out in the middle, so it wouldn't rot inside. But ya can wear it as a hat now!
The Silver Plater - Plated the Turnip

get: You find a couple of things that still look edible.

nine: You found a filthy slime-covered old brooch, are you happy? I bet you're going to put it on without even washing it first.
